title: The world studies of abuse in the family environment (WorldSAFE): a model of a multi-national study of family violence
abstract: The World Studies of Abuse in the Family Environment (WorldSAFE) designed and implemented a study of family violence – intimate partner violence and child abuse and neglect – using standardized methods to cover over 12,000 women in eighteen communities within five lesser-developed countries. The rationale, process and methods for developing the population-based survey are described. Standardized methods included common training of investigators and field staff, sampling strategies, eligibility criteria, instruments, data collection methods, operational definitions, analysis strategies and data management. Special features of the WorldSAFE model are described – namely an ecological conceptual framework, an extensive and broad-based dissemination strategy, and community advisory boards.
